title: Inscribed funerary urn of Flavianos
support:
A rectangular white marble urn, with a lid. The lid has
                                            acroteria on each of the four corners. The urn has square fluted columns
                                            depicted in relief on each vertical corner, and a tabula ansata in light
                                            relief fills the front face.

layout.p:
Greek text over four lines, centred in the main panel of the
                                        tabula ansata on the front face of the urn.

handNote.lettering:
Neat and regular square letters. Phi and omicron are rhomboid in
                                    form; standard four-bar sigma; epsilon has horizontal bars of equal length; alpha
                                    has a slightly extended apex; mu has extended apices, and all four strokes are full
                                    length and off-vertical. There is one instance of ligature in line 3, and
                                    interpuncts are in the form of simple triangular incisions.

date._: 69 CE — first half of 2nd century CE

provenanceFound._: Found in 1913 in a Roman tomb uncovered during building works in prop. Guglielmino, in the area known as Orto del Re (probably the insula bounded by via Nino Martoglio, via Stellata, via Orto San Clemente, and via Reclusorio del Lume).
